title: From Epstein to Obama, Trump’s Washington Is Consumed by Competing Conspiracies
summary: President Trump is trying to divert attention from the Epstein conspiracy theory with a new-and-improved one about Barack Obama and treason.

title: A Clash Over a Promotion Puts Hegseth at Odds With His Generals
summary: Suspicions about leaks and a mistrust of senior military officers have defined much of the defense secretary’s first six months on the job.

title: Right-Wing Influencers Say Ghislaine Maxwell Is Key to Unlocking Epstein Case
summary: Some conservative influencers have celebrated the move to approach the longtime associate of Jeffrey Epstein, but it comes with risks.

title: No Proof Hamas Routinely Stole U.N. Aid, Israeli Military Officials Say
summary: Israel has long restricted aid to Gaza on the argument that Hamas steals it to use as a weapon of control over the population. On Saturday, the Israeli military announced new airdrops of aid.

title: Amid Growing Fury Over Gaza, Israel Says It Is Easing Aid Restrictions
summary: As starvation rises in Gaza, prompting global outrage, Israel’s military said it would restart airborne aid delivery there and make land deliveries less dangerous.

title: What to Know About the Deadly Shootings Near a Gaza Aid Site
summary: The head of the United Nations, Antonio Guterres, said the situation in Gaza was “a moral crisis that challenges the global conscience.”

title: A Kennedy Toils in Mississippi, Tracing His Grandfather’s Path
summary: Joe Kennedy III, the grandson of Senator Robert F. Kennedy, says there is work to do in red states. He also has a few things to say about his uncle, Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

title: This Democrat Wants Cognitive Standards in Congress. Her Colleagues Disagree.
summary: Representative Marie Gluesenkamp Perez says age-related cognitive decline among elected officials is a major issue for voters.

title: E.U. Cuts Aid to Ukraine Over Corruption Concerns
summary: The $1.7 billion reduction capped a tough week for President Volodymyr Zelensky as he deals with Ukraine’s governance issues.

title: In Russia, Corruption Cases Follow Battlefield Failures
summary: Officials in three of the five Russian regions bordering Ukraine have been accused of embezzling funds for border defenses.

title: He Read (at Least) 3,599 Books in His Lifetime. Now Anyone Can See His List.
summary: After Dan Pelzer died this month at 92, his children uploaded the handwritten reading list to what-dan-read.com, hoping to inspire readers everywhere.

title: Thailand and Cambodia Trade Fire Despite Cease-Fire Promises
summary: President Trump said on Saturday that both countries had agreed to a halt in the fighting. But on Sunday morning, skirmishes erupted once more.

title: What to Know About the Thailand-Cambodia Clash
summary: The conflict over the shared border between the two countries grew on Saturday, in the deadliest conflict between them in more than a decade.

title: Houston’s Astrodome Was a Vision of the Future. It’s Past Its Prime.
summary: Once a wonder of the world, the storied but moldering stadium has long been part of life in Houston. Is it worth saving?

title: Saving for College Once Felt Essential. Some Parents Are Rethinking Their Plans.
summary: Generations of parents have opened 529 plans to save for their children’s educations. Now some are reconsidering the value of college and looking into other options.

title: 11 People Injured in Stabbing at a Michigan Walmart, Officials Say
summary: One person was in custody after what the authorities said was a random attack at a store near Traverse City, Mich.

title: Hunter Noack and His Piano Have Reached the Mountaintop
summary: The classical pianist Hunter Noack has embarked on an unusual journey, to take his music to natural landscapes well beyond the concert halls.

title: If I Don’t Post About My Vacation on Instagram, Did It Even Happen?
summary: I know that craving the high of posting, of all those comments and hearts, is lame, but leaving is really hard.

title: Opinion: The Path to Peace in the Middle East (and a Nobel Prize for Trump)
summary: A possible path to peace in the Middle East.

title: Drivers vs. Cyclists: A Battle for the Streets in Canada’s Largest City
summary: Cyclists in Toronto are resisting a law that would have the city rip out miles of bike lanes, setting back efforts toward safer streets.

title: Seven Charged in Child Abuse Ring Run From an Alabama Bunker, Officials Say
summary: A sheriff called it the worst child abuse case he’d seen in his 33-year career. Victims as young as 3 are now in state care and getting medical, emotional and psychological support.

title: Illinois Man Convicted in Killing of Palestinian American Boy Dies in Custody
summary: Joseph Czuba, who was convicted of killing 6-year-old Wadee Alfayoumi in 2023, died two months after a judge sentenced him to 53 years in prison. He was 73.

title: James Leprino, ‘Willy Wonka of Cheese’ Who Revolutionized Pizza, Dies at 87
summary: He turned a small family grocery store into a mozzarella empire, producing most of the cheese for American pizza chains like Domino’s, Papa Johns and Pizza Hut.
